required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preventive Effects of Ginseng Against Atherosclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Preventive Effects of Ginseng Against Atherosclerosis and Subsequent Ischemic Stroke: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a 12-month, double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial. The purpose of this study is to determine whether ginseng is effective in the prevention of atherosclerosis and subsequent ischemic stroke. High-risk patients with severe atherosclerosis in the major intracranial arteries and extracranial carotid artery were enrolled.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The Composite of Cerebral Ischemic Stroke and Transient Ischemic Attack
primary_outcome.description: The 1-year composite of cerebral ischemic stroke and transient ischemic attack downstream to an atherosclerotic lesion

Presence of other cerebro-cardiovascular morbidity or mortality assessed by aggravation of patient status (modified Rankin Scale). The modified Rankin Scale is ranging from 0 to 5. The higher scale indicates the worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Changes in Volumetric Blood Flow (ml/Sec) in Intracranial Vessels.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At randomization and twelve months after randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: The changes in volumetric blood flow (ml/sec) in intracranial vessels assessed by quantitative magnetic resonance angiography with noninvasive optimal vessel analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Changes of White Matter Hyperintensities.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At randomization and twelve months after randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of white matter hyperintensities, assessed by the Fazekas scale using brain magnetic resonance imaging. The Fazekas scale is a 4 point white matter disease severity scale with values ranging from 0 to 3. It quantifies the amount of white matter T2 hyperintense lesions each in periventricular white matter and deep white matter. Higher scales mean a worse white matter status. In the region of the periventricular white matter, 0 means absence of the lesion; 1, caps or pencil-thin lining lesion; 2, smooth halo lesion; 3, irregular high intense signal extending into the deep shite matter. In the region of the deep white matter, 0 means absence of the lesion; 1, punctate foci lesions; 2, beginning confluence; 3, large confluent hyperintense areas.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Changes of Parenchymal Ischemic Lesions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At randomization and twelve months after randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of ischemic parenchymal lesions, assessed by brain magnetic resonance images acquired at randomization and twelve months after randomization. We counted the number of participants who had new ischemic parenchymal lesions at twelve months after randomization.

other_outcome.description: We calculated average drug compliance based on the number of remained drugs at each follow-up.

intervention.description: Korean Red Ginseng extract tablet (0.5 grams/tablet, 2 tablets twice a day) daily for 12 months.
Placebo (0.5 grams/tablet, 2 tablets twice a day) daily for 12 months.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients in a single center, from June 2016 to June 2017.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Baseline modified Rankin Scale (mRS)
measure.description: The modified Rankin scale (mRS) is a 6 point disability scale with possible scales ranging from 0 to 5. If the patient has no stroke symptoms, the value of the mRS is 0; able to carry out all pre-stroke activities, 1; unable to carry out all pre-stroke activities but is able to look after self without daily help, 2; requires some external help but is able to walk without the assistance of another individual, 3; unable to walk or attend to bodily functions without the assistance of another individual, 4; bedridden, incontinent, requires continuous care, 5.

outcome.title: The Composite of Cerebral Ischemic Stroke and Transient Ischemic Attack
outcome.description: The 1-year composite of cerebral ischemic stroke and transient ischemic attack downstream to an atherosclerotic lesion

group.description: Korean Red Ginseng extract tablet (0.5 grams/tablet, 2 tablets twice a day) daily for 12 months.

measure.title: The Composite of Cerebral Ischemic Stroke and Transient Ischemic Attack
measure.description: The 1-year composite of cerebral ischemic stroke and transient ischemic attack downstream to an atherosclerotic lesion

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is that there is no relationship between ginseng administration and cerebral ischemic events including ischemic stroke and transient ischemic attack. The number of participants who suffered ischemic stroke and the number of paticipants who suffered transient ischemic attack were analyzed together to test the null hypothesis in two by two table.

outcome.title: Modified Rankin Scale
outcome.description: Presence of other cerebro-cardiovascular morbidity or mortality assessed by aggravation of patient status (modified Rankin Scale). The modified Rankin Scale is ranging from 0 to 5. The higher scale indicates the worse outcome.

group.description: Korean Red Ginseng extract tablet (0.5 grams/tablet, 2 tablets twice a day) daily for 12 months.

measure.title: Modified Rankin Scale
measure.description: Presence of other cerebro-cardiovascular morbidity or mortality assessed by aggravation of patient status (modified Rankin Scale). The modified Rankin Scale is ranging from 0 to 5. The higher scale indicates the worse outcome.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is that there is no relationship between ginseng administration and modified Rankin Scale at follow-up.

measure.title: The Changes in Volumetric Blood Flow (ml/Sec) in Intracranial Vessels.
measure.description: The changes in volumetric blood flow (ml/sec) in intracranial vessels assessed by quantitative magnetic resonance angiography with noninvasive optimal vessel analysis.

class.title: The flow change in steno-occlusive lesion
The flow change in collateral vessel

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is that there is no relationship between ginseng administration and flow change in steno-occlusive lesion.
The null hypothesis is that there is no relationship between ginseng administration and flow change in collateral vessel.

outcome.title: The Changes of White Matter Hyperintensities.
outcome.description: The changes of white matter hyperintensities, assessed by the Fazekas scale using brain magnetic resonance imaging. The Fazekas scale is a 4 point white matter disease severity scale with values ranging from 0 to 3. It quantifies the amount of white matter T2 hyperintense lesions each in periventricular white matter and deep white matter. Higher scales mean a worse white matter status. In the region of the periventricular white matter, 0 means absence of the lesion; 1, caps or pencil-thin lining lesion; 2, smooth halo lesion; 3, irregular high intense signal extending into the deep shite matter. In the region of the deep white matter, 0 means absence of the lesion; 1, punctate foci lesions; 2, beginning confluence; 3, large confluent hyperintense areas.
outcome.time_frame: At randomization and twelve months after randomization.

group.title: Ginseng
group.description: Korean Red Ginseng extract tablet (0.5 grams/tablet, 2 tablets twice a day) daily for 12 months.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (0.5 grams/tablet, 2 tablets twice a day) daily for 12 months.

measure.title: The Changes of White Matter Hyperintensities.
measure.description: The changes of white matter hyperintensities, assessed by the Fazekas scale using brain magnetic resonance imaging. The Fazekas scale is a 4 point white matter disease severity scale with values ranging from 0 to 3. It quantifies the amount of white matter T2 hyperintense lesions each in periventricular white matter and deep white matter. Higher scales mean a worse white matter status. In the region of the periventricular white matter, 0 means absence of the lesion; 1, caps or pencil-thin lining lesion; 2, smooth halo lesion; 3, irregular high intense signal extending into the deep shite matter. In the region of the deep white matter, 0 means absence of the lesion; 1, punctate foci lesions; 2, beginning confluence; 3, large confluent hyperintense areas.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is that there is no relationship between ginseng administration and periventricular white matter lesions at follow-up.
The null hypothesis is that there is no relationship between ginseng administration and deep white matter lesions at follow-up.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Changes of Parenchymal Ischemic Lesions
outcome.description: The changes of ischemic parenchymal lesions, assessed by brain magnetic resonance images acquired at randomization and twelve months after randomization. We counted the number of participants who had new ischemic parenchymal lesions at twelve months after randomization.
outcome.time_frame: At randomization and twelve months after randomization.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Changes of Parenchymal Ischemic Lesions
measure.description: The changes of ischemic parenchymal lesions, assessed by brain magnetic resonance images acquired at randomization and twelve months after randomization. We counted the number of participants who had new ischemic parenchymal lesions at twelve months after randomization.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is that there is no relationship between ginseng administration and parenchymal ischemic lesions at follow-up.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The difficulty in determining the size of the study population due to the lack of previous studies. The relatively short follow-up period considering chronic atherosclerotic disease. The absence of surrogate biochemical markers to confirm ginsenosides' effects.
